Package com.nokia.maps.routing

The routing package defines provides classes for route calculation.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Maneuver
    This interface defines a maneuver, which describes an action that a person needs to perform when following a route.
    Route
    This interface defines a route.
    RouteLeg
    This interface defines a route leg, which represents a section of a route between two consecutive waypoints.
    RouteListener
    This interface defines a series of callback methods which are used to monitor RouteRequest events.
    RouteRequest
    This interface acts as a proxy to the routing service and is responsible for storing the currently selected routes.
    RouteSummary
    This class presents route's summary.
    Waypoint
    This class defines a waypoint, which is a point along a route explicitly specified as part of route definition as a location through which the route must pass.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Mode
    The Mode encapsulates the parameters for one route calculation.
    RouteFactory
    This class is used to instantiate the routing implementation.
    WaypointParameterList
    The WaypointParameterList wraps a list of waypoints in potentially different representations.

Package com.nokia.maps.routing Description

The routing package defines provides classes for route calculation.

Routing

RouteFactory provides access to the Nokia routing service.

To calculate a route, you need:

  • at least two waypoints - for the start and end points of the route; these are instances of com.nokia.maps.routing.Waypoint
  • a routing mode - to control route calculation features; this is an instance of com.nokia.maps.routing.RoutingMode

Routing requests can be carried out synchronously or asynchronously. The latter offers the advantage of off-loading time-consuming operations to another thread. To submit an asynchronous route calculation request, define a RouteListener and call one of the asynchronous route calculation methods RouteRequest.

The code below calculates a route through coordinates contained in WaypointParameterList using the default routing mode (see below for more information on RoutingMode). 

        
            WaypointParameterList waypoints = new WaypointParameterList();
            ...
            RouteFactory rf = RouteFactory.getInstance();
            RouteRequest routeRequest = rf.createRouteRequest();
            Mode mode = new Mode();
            Route[] routes = createRouteRequest.calculateRoute(waypoints, modes);

The method RouteRequest.calculateRoute() takes a Mode object as a parameter that defines the preferences for a route calculation. An instance of RoutingMode can combine values from the following interfaces defined in com.nokia.maps.routing:

  • AVOID_DIRTROAD
  • AVOID_MOTORWAY
  • AVOID_PARK
  • AVOID_PUBLICTRANSPORT
  • AVOID_RAILFERRY
  • AVOID_STAIRS
  • AVOID_TOLLROAD
  • AVOID_TUNNEL
  • PREFER_HOVLANE

The class TransportMode can be used to define the mode of transport. This can be one of the following:

  • CAR
  • PEDESTRIAN
  • PUBLICTRANSPORT

The class RouteType can be used to define the mode of transport. This can be one of the following:

  • DIRECT_DRIVE
  • ECONOMIC
  • FASTEST
  • FASTEST_NOW
  • SCENIC
  • SHORTEST

The elements from the RouteFeature class can be used to define the routing options. See all the possible options in RouteFeature
